frontmatter.title: Fancy lab tutorial template
frontmatter.description: Demonstration of how to build the markdown document to be nicely formatted on Gatsby carbon site

internal.content:
--- title: Fancy lab tutorial template description: Demonstration of how to build the markdown document to be nicely formatted on Gatsby carbon site --- This page is meant to demonstrate some of the components in action. You can check out the markdown used for this page [on github](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/gatsby-theme-carbon/blob/main/packages/example/src/pages/demo/index.mdx). The HTML tags in the document are optional, you can use them to get some nice formatting not available with regular markdown, e.g. graphical tiles for links Two column section heading Not working link as there is no matching header Small anchor links Images Videos ![Dark article layout mockup](/images/Article_06.png) ![Dark article layout mockup](/images/Article_06.png) ![Dark article layout mockup](/images/Article_06.png) Lab tutorial description goes here Additional text like lab prerequisites or other information goes here ## Two column section heading Two column formated tutorial section introduction goes here. Fully optional. Delete the whole content between `Row` HTML tags to remove from the tutorial. The text in this section shows different formatting options ```sh echo "This is a sample Shell script" ``` ```yaml apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: nginx-deployment labels: app: nginx spec: replicas: 3 selector: matchLabels: app: nginx template: metadata: labels: app: nginx spec: containers: - name: nginx image: nginx:1.14.2 ports: - containerPort: 80 ``` [Sample code file](/samples/sample.json) External link that opens a new browser tab **This is bold text** *This is italic text* > This is a highlighted text - can be used for example for famous quotes > which spans multiple lines This is a regular text This text is in red

This is a fancy
comment box
on the right side

Can be used as a comment to the main content but managing formatting can be bothersome. In such case, do not use.
## Small anchor links This section defines links to the headers below. Text in `AnchorLink` tags must match the Headers below for this to work. Header Header again ### Header Tutorial section content goes here ### Header again Tutorial section content goes here 1. This is a demonstration of an ordered list item. This list item is particularly long to demonstrate how the text wraps and aligns with the first line. 1. This is a nested list item, it should wrap in the same way. Typically, nested list items should be of the same type (ordered, unordered) as their parent. 1. Ordered list item 1. Ordered list item - This is a demonstration of an unordered list item. This list item is particularly long to demonstrate how the text wraps and aligns with the first line. - This is a nested list item, it should wrap in the same way. Typically, nested list items should be of the same type (ordered, unordered) as their parent. - Unordered list item - Unordered list item ## Images This section shows how to link global images from `src/images` subdirectory. The amount of upward directory references `..` in the path must much the directory structure of your tutorials. Do not use it if you doen't have to - it creates problems when you change the directory structure of the tutorial pages ![If you see this text it means you get the path wrong](../../../../images/large-image.jpg) ## Videos This is a sample how to embed a link to Vimeo video
